intro: Anthocercis viscosa subsp. caudata, commonly known as the hairy anthocercis, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are small and clustered, often white or pale green in color. It is primarily found in specific regions of South America, where it thrives in humid, temperate climates.
